alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 10:17AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A snow squall will impact portions of northeastern Essex, southern Lamoille, west central Caledonia, northwestern Addison, Chittenden and northern Washington Counties through 1100 AM EST... At 1016 AM EST, A snow squall was reported along a line extending from near Underhill to near Jay In Essex County. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Visibility less than a mile. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility may pose a hazard to motorists. Locations impacted include... Essex Junction, South Burlington, Burlington International Airport, Vergennes, Burlington, Montpelier, St. Johnsbury, Willsboro, Westport, Elizabethtown, Calais, Winooski, Monkton Ridge, Waterbury Village, Monkton, Monkton Boro, Essex Junction Village, Williston, New Haven, and Worcester. This includes the following highways... Interstate 87 between mile markers 115 and 131. Interstate 89 between mile markers 55 and 90.
info.instruction: Rapid visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to produce hazardous driving conditions. travel is not advised during this snow squall. If you are traveling and encounter adverse winter driving conditions, reduce speed and make sure headlights are on to increase the visibility of your vehicle to those around you. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
